intro: Ochagavia chamissonis, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble dandelions. The plant has a low-growing, mat-forming habit with fleshy, succulent leaves that help it retain moisture in dry environments. Its yellow flowers bloom in spring, producing small seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Ochagavia chamissonis is adapted to withstand extreme temperatures and is often found in rocky soils and desert scrub habitats.
